parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The identifier of the account. Often referred to as the account number, yet for consistency this is always referred to as accountId.

parameters.name: displayName
parameters.description: The name used for display purposes

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The total number of records per page

parameters.name: page_start
parameters.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from t24 on every enquiry request.

parameters.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from t24 on every enquiry request.

parameters.description: The total number of records per page

parameters.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from t24 on every enquiry request.

bookingDate.description: The date on which the entry was generated. Normally, but not necessarily, the actual date at the time the entry is generated, e.g. if the previous day's business is still being processed after midnight, the actual date changes, but the run date is still the previous day.

narrative.description: The additional text printed on descriptive statements in addition to the standard narrative and/or reference

accountId.description: The identifier of the account. Often referred to as the account number, yet for consistency this is always referred to as accountId.

currencyId.description: The identifier of the curreny. The is the 3 letter ISO 4217 code of the currency.

accountName.description: The name of the account that is displayed

companyId.description: The identifier of the company, following the format CCGGGLLLL, where: CC is the country code, GGG is Company Group Code and LLLL is the Local Code. Country Code must be a valid countryCode, Company Group Code must be 3 numeric characters in the range 001-999 and must be a valid companyGroup. The Local Code is 4 numeric characters in the range 0001-9999, e.g. GB0010001

imageId.description: The identifier of the image used for advertisement

code.description: The identifier of the error message

T24_time.description: Time taken to response by T24

parse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

page_size.description: The total number of records per page

page_start.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

total_size.description: The total number of records present

page_token.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from t24 on every enquiry request

T24_time.description: Time taken to response by T24

parse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

debitCurrencyId.description: The identifier of the debit currency

debitValueDate.description: The date on which the Invocation amount will be debited for settlement

debitAccountId.description: The identifier of the debit account

creditCurrencyId.description: The identifier of the credit currency

creditAmount.description: The amount to be credited in a payment transaction

creditValueDate.description: The value date applied to the credit side of a payment

creditAccountId.description: The identifier of the credit account

beneficiaryIBAN.description: The IBAN of the beneficiary's account

beneficiaryAccountId.description: The identifier of the beneficiary account

beneficiaryCustomerId.description: The customer identifier where the beneficiary is a customer of the bank

bookingDate.description: The date on which the entry was generated. Normally, but not necessarily, the actual date at the time the entry is generated, e.g. if the previous day's business is still being processed after midnight, the actual date changes, but the run date is still the previous day.

narrative.description: The additional text printed on descriptive statements in addition to the standard narrative and/or reference

currencyId.description: The identifier of the curreny. The is the 3 letter ISO 4217 code of the currency.

chargeAmount.description: Holds the charge amount equivalent in charge account currency

processingDate.description: The bank date that an accounting movement is applied to the bank GL

chequeNumber.description: The cheque number. Formed as chequeType.accountId.chequeOrDraftNumber. See chequeId

accountId.description: The identifier of the account. Often referred to as the account number, yet for consistency this is always referred to as accountId.

customerRate.description: The exchange rate that is actually used to convert an amount from one currency to another in a payment transaction.

imageId.description: The identifier of the image used for advertisement

imageType.description: Identifies the type of image to be stored and its location. Typical usage would be to segregate images by criteria such as PASSPORTS, PHOTOGRAPHS, SIGNATURES and DOCUMENTS. Image types can be used to assist selection of records in Enquiries as well as the physical distribution of files.Must be a valid record on IM.IMAGE.TYPE.

bookingDate.description: The date on which the entry was generated. Normally, but not necessarily, the actual date at the time the entry is generated, e.g. if the previous day's business is still being processed after midnight, the actual date changes, but the run date is still the previous day.

narrative.description: The additional text printed on descriptive statements in addition to the standard narrative and/or reference

currencyId.description: The identifier of the curreny. The is the 3 letter ISO 4217 code of the currency.

accountId.description: The identifier of the account. Often referred to as the account number, yet for consistency this is always referred to as accountId.

accountName.description: The name of the account that is displayed

companyId.description: The identifier of the company, following the format CCGGGLLLL, where: CC is the country code, GGG is Company Group Code and LLLL is the Local Code. Country Code must be a valid countryCode, Company Group Code must be 3 numeric characters in the range 001-999 and must be a valid companyGroup. The Local Code is 4 numeric characters in the range 0001-9999, e.g. GB0010001
